comments.commentBody:
I don't pretend to know of every contact with the Russians. And I don't pretend to know what to make of them. I hoped this article would help me in two important ways, but it did not.

To judge the propriety of these contacts, it would be helpful to know what others have done. Information about Clinton's contacts would have helped. And information about Obama's contacts when he was President elect would have helped too.

Just as important, because this is all about election tampering, I would like to know which contacts occurred before the election and which occurred after. It seems to me that if all the contacts occurred before November 8, that would be valuable circumstantial evidence.

Even if Trump or his advisors met with Russian diplomats, that is NOT evidence of "election tampering".

Tampering would be hacking voting machines...using money or influence to buy votes...dumping or destroying votes...or stuff like turning a blind eye when illegal aliens vote, because you know they will vote for YOUR candidate.

If any of these thing were done, surely somebody would be investigating that? Rather than spinning their wheels trying to see "who met whom"?

I've met and talked to lots of people in my life, who did not in any way "influence me". Just chatting with someone does not prove "influence peddling".

Prior to November 8th....a Russian agent who believed that "Trump could win" had to be delusional, because Trump was way behind, had no newspaper endorsements and was widely predicted to lose a humiliating landslide defeat. Even his own CHILDREN warned Trump this was about to happen, and to brace himself.

So what made Russians so prescient and all-knowing? I have not heard ANYTHING that seriously proves any Russian involvement. If they DID figure out Trump would win....I guess they are smarter than the NYT and the entirety of the lefty liberal punditry.

To this point, one clear indictment of this administration is that it and its surrogates were untruthfully in their insistence there had been no contact with Russian officials. As regards any conspiracy beyond that, there is as yet no smoking gun. As evidence of that contact grows however, the defence has switched from outright denial to one of portraying it as normal. And that indeed could be the case.

Republicans are demanding more information, Democrats want a full-fledged investigation and media pundits are exhorting the White House to get out ahead of what promises to be at least a huge, enduring distraction by releasing the full chronology of meetings and discussions that took place.

Fair enough, but that list should include all contacts with foreign governments - not just those from Russia. Why? Well because it would demonstrate whether the Russian connection was an outlier - whether the type and frequency of contact was well beyond the norm.

None of Trump's associates disclosed their meetings with Russian officials on their own. Now that they have been discovered, and are questioned about those conversations, they all claim they were completely harmless and had nothing to do with the campaign. If that's true, why would they have not come forward on their own months ago to acknowledge that they had discussions with Russian officials or others close to Putin?

The FBI and US intelligence services must have recordings and possibly witness accounts of at least some of these exchanges. How will that information be dealt with? Will the White House and the Republican majorities in Congress suppress it? The continuing leaks to reporters suggests that there are some working on this investigation who have no confidence that it will ever be fully disclosed and dealt with in a proper Congressional inquiry.

And why did the FBI feel it had to raise the issue of Clinton's emails (which was against dismissed as no wrong doing) 11 days before the election but chose not to do the same with the information the had on Trump?

We know that the Russians undertook cyber warfare to interfere with our election and to damage Hillary Clinton. We also know that Trump and his associates-- Paul Manafort, General Michael Flynn-- had continuing relations with Russian oligarchs and high government officials, including Vladimir Putin. Furthermore, Donald Trump, Jr. claimed that the Trump organization had significant dealings and investments in Russia.

The outcome of the election was a surprise to everyone, including Donald Trump. It is possible that his efforts to ingratiate himself with Putin were motivated in part by a wish to expand his business in Russia, even if he lost.

The growing cloud over his Administration will continue to impede its efforts to govern effectively. The country faces an impending crisis. We must lance the boil. A relatively easy way to do this would be to subpoena Mr. Trump's tax returns.

Tax returns would be no panacea; these guys operate on another level, with their own rules. How much money has Putin laundered through Trump businesses? That's what's going on. Trump seems to only have lost money, yet he bathes in the trappings of wealth. His money is coming from somewhere; follow the money.

In 2016, Fox News (as well as other media more trustworthy outlets) reported on the results of an Australian scientific study that indicated that approximately 20% of CEOs and prisoners are psychopaths. (http://www.foxnews.com/health/2016/09/15/your-ceo-could-be-actual-psycho... This percentage is much higher than in the general population. The psychopath can appear normal, even charming. Underneath, he/she lacks conscience and empathy, making him/her manipulative, volatile and often (but by no means always) criminal. Trump is a classical psychopath, but the diagnosis does not stop at the president. Although the researchers did not study politicians, it would be surprising if there wasn’t a higher percentage of psychopaths in politics and a disproportionately higher percentage as Republican politicians. Recent research indicates that the diagnosis of psychopathy can be made with PET scans of the brain. Perhaps all politicians should be required to have such scans and their results be part of full disclosure when they run for political office.

Russian diplomats may well have been trying to reach out to Trump's associates and to other political figures at the time of the election and at many other times, for obvious reasons. This does not prove any nefarious dealings were ongoing or even ever initiated. The DNC and their large cadre of hacks - who are still unable to accept their loss - want to blame the Russians, and especially are hoping for some collusion with the Trump campaign to become evident. This is just a pathetic deflection of their own responsibility in having alienated the majority of people in the mid-portion of our nation. They have insulated themselves in that bi-coastal bubble for so long, that they were obviously not even aware of how they have, long ago, lost the support of so many Americans over the last 8 years. They can chase their conspiracy theories until "the cows come home", but they are going to be sadly disappointed. The Russians may well have played their games - not unlike the games that we have played while mucking in the affairs of many other nations. But this election loss lays at the feet of the arrogant and foolish politicians who were in power for too long, and who forgot that the American people could ultimately take it all away from them.

Then why do they lie?

Question if there was a meeting - deny.
Indications that there may have been a meeting - double down and deny.
Good proof that meeting occurred - deflect, demean and deny.
Irrefutable proof of meeting that finally sticks - "Oh, THAT meeting! It was nothing!"
Next Step:
Indicia of content of conversations - deny.
Good proof of meeting content - attack the leakers and everyone asking.
Irrefutable proof of treason against the United States - step down from new position.... Unless that position is a really good one, in which case, recuse yourself for now, but hang onto all the power you can, for as long as you can, and hope the American people will somehow become distracted and forget.

If a meeting was innocent, one does not deny the meeting took place.

anne vincent; be patient, the days and weeks will pass soon enough and your chosen words may come back to haunt all of us in a way that will forever change the United States of America.

But, not in a good way.

No.  This election which will prove to be a disaster for our beloved country lies at the feet of the feckless Republicans who gerrymandered their way into office  and who think they can control this beast.  They can't.

We need to understand that most comments made by Trump apply to himself or the Republican party. He means the opposite of what he says. Trump's distortions malign individuals (including Obama, of course) to government agencies (and employees) to our planet. Lying Hillary = lying Trump. Lock her up = lock him & his team up. Believe me = you're on the right track, don't trust me. Make America Great = America is great. Mexico will pay for the wall = Mexico will not. Obamacare is a disaster = Republican health care proposals are a disaster. I had no contact with Putin = I have had contact. Climate change is a Chinese hoax = climate denial is a Republican hoax. More guns make us safer = not so much. Fewer regulations is good for business = fewer regulations are bad for the American people. I won't release my tax returns = I don't pay taxes and you shouldn't know who loans me money (like Russian oligarchs).

This man cannot continue as our president. From his Russian connections to his belligerent attitude toward people of color and religious and sexual expressions we have a leader who fails to represent the best of America.

Hillary Clinton won the popular election. Donald Trump won the electoral college election. Which of those elections was 'by the people, for the people'? Donald Trump does not have a mandate nor he does represent the winning side of the popular election. Yet he and his crew are acting as if a majority of voters elected to put them in the White House for the purpose of carrying out radical alterations to our fundamental institutions which will have negative impacts on many the very people who voted Trump into office. So far his plans offer nothing to the middle and lower classes. Nothing except the loss of medical-care, social services and consumer health and safety protections. On the other hand the wealthy have already seen trillions added to their Wall Street portfolios. And Trump's just getting started. It will get far far worse for the little people over the next four or eight years unless this guy gets us al nuked at some point down the lane. A distinct possibility as far as I'm concerned.

But the President IS NOT elected by a popular vote. Everyone who has read the Constitution knows this. Why don't YOU know this?

GW Bush did not win the popular vote, and he only won the EC with ONE MEASLY VOTE -- I think this is the lowest win in history. He had no mandate. Yet he was able to not only get re-elected, but lead us into two long-lasting wars.

You seem to think that if a President does not get the popular vote, he is not allowed to have full Presidential powers....is just a figurehead. That is factually untrue.
but you forget that Hillary ' s popular vote win was all illegals...

By all appearances, it looks like the chickens are coming home to roost -- and Republicans will now get a taste of their own medicine when it comes to so-called "witch hunts", as mounting eveidence points to implicit relationships between Russian actors and several Trump associates.
And the list grows longer each passing day, with the most recent discovery that Attorney General Jeff Sessions conveniently forgot to disclose a meeting he had with the Russian Ambassador to the U.S., while sitting in front of his confitmation hearing.
Of course Mr. Trump will resort to the lessons he has learned from his mentor, Roy Cohn, by doubling down on the insults, accusations, and denials, but in the end nothing compares to hard evidence and a smoking gun...or, two.

It is important for everyone to put pressure on the GOP to stand for our country over their party.

This is all on them. Trump is the anomaly. The GOP has chosen Trump over America so they must now do the dirty work or go down with the ship.
Independent of what?

This is all no "nothing burger", that's for sure. Nevertheless, liberals shouldn't become so worked up about Trump's alleged contacts with Russia that they lose sight of the bigger picture. Trumpism must be defeated not just Trump. It's not just Beltway power brokers but ordinary Americans who voted for Trump have to be convinced that his politics are a bust.  These "gifts" from the White House give progressives a tactical advantage but they don't give them a strategy - they'll have to come up with one of those the hard way.

Bill - That ship has sailed. Democrats have lost most Americans who voted for Trump, with the abuse they have heaped upon them for a year. And your point of view is one dimensional. You are suggesting that you have the only valid point of view and others do not, whom you have to persuade to your own position. Not a whole lot of humility in that position. Trumpism, defeated? What does that even mean? What the heck is Trumpism? Something you have made up and then attributed to 65 million people who voted for Trump with your own personal speculation and assumptions.

And what does it mean that his politics are bust? First of all, don't equate conservative values and policy positions, with Trump. He may have gotten elected because he had a handle on the underlying unhappiness of most conservatives in this country, but he certainly doesn't represent the essence of what most Americans were trying to accomplish. But the Democrats have policies that remain untenable. Whether Trump stays or goes. And the Democratic party that kept Nancy Pelosi in position and elected Perez and Ellison to head the party are so blind to their own faults that the very obvious hypocrisy of any Democrat suggesting the Democrats need to bring the country under it's control seems pretty self delusional.

And the more the country watches the organized, frenzied attack by what I can only guess are Clinton supporters, to imbed and dislodge the Trump administration... it's an ugly view.
When they lose their health insurance and all those manufacturing jobs don't appear they'll learn soon enough.
Maybe when Social Security and Medicare are privatized and grabbed by the invisible hand of the market, the 65 million voters may change their views.

No one seems to remember meeting with Ambassador Sergey Kislyak, until they are caught lying.

Is it because he drinks vodka instead of Dos Equis? He could be "the Most Uninteresting Man in the World!" Stay thirsty Democratic friends, stay thirsty.
Worry more about what Trump is hiding from the citizens of the USA than about catching the individuals helping us find out the facts.
On the basis of a spread-spectrum analysis, all signals point to the same thing.
I propose that everyone just start reporting every single one of Donald Trumps tweets as offensive, abusive and insensitivity or perhaps just spam!

One hates to be simplistic, but if Trump and his associates would stop lying and tell the truth, we might get to the bottom of this.  Or is it too late for that?  Or, is there something so sordid at the bottom of this mess that they dare not suddenly become honest?
Blessed are those who can morally account for every move they make.

Let's face it, we can't could on either party to do the right thing, both parties are Hypocrite with no morals, it whatever it takes to get and keep the power and line their pockets with as much gold as they can.
It time to Ban both parties from holding office from the city all the way to the federal level. All current and past leadership so be put on trial for treason.
A potent third party might help, if only to wander around, by day, with a lantern, looking for an honest person.

See, now, I'm neutral. I didn't vote for Clinton or Trump. I'm as interested as anyone else for an investigation, but my understanding was that the intelligent communities were already investigating it since the campaign. So, what's taking so long? Why is there not enough information yet to form conclusions? Or will we be tying up government and stagnating due to partisan politics for another administration?

Meanwhile Obama ruled the roost with executive orders that provoked anger, while Repubs and Dems in Congress brought governing to a halt. And now we have a new administration and the same thing is happening. No governing. Just mud slinging. And the Democratic party can not pretend to not be 1000% motivated in removing Trump from office. Anyone that denies that is fooling no one. There is an organized attempt to overthrow the administration.

So I agree with dog secrets - both parties are not worth supporting. And just the fact that only 3 people up voted this comment, tells you all you need to know about the hypocrisy and denial of Democrats, who continue to suggest that only the Republicans are a problem. There is no impartiality or objectivity.

???

Both parties?

Ban?

Both, Treason?

Too much coffee this morning?!

The Russian people are certainly not our enemy, but the same cannot and should be not said about the Kremlin.  Their history since Putin's ascendency is rich with corruption, murder, manipulation, misinformation and disinformation.  'Tis not the time to 'move on' but to move in and see what's what and why.

Republicans who oppose an independent investigation will be vulnerable in their own re-election battles.  When the truth comes out they'll be seen to be supporting a tainted and treacherous administration.

The Republicans have a limited window to get cracking on an investigation of this outsider, before they get tarred with his brush. Either Putin has something on a bunch of them too, or they hope to pull off a bunch of bad legislation quickly, get Trump's signature on it, and then start the investigation.

I think the media can be a big help here concerning "anti-Russian hysteria."  The media needs to show the truth; that Putin is not an accurate representation for the Russian people.  This is very important, not to stoke old cold war wounds again.
One can avoid seeing, hearing, or speaking at any stage of the process.
Trump's tax returns no doubt lead to shell corporations with bombproof law firms hiding them. I wonder why he will not release them, like other Presidential candidates do?

Here's also why millennials should care: because a foreign power that interferes in our democratic system means the end of democracy and everything we take for granted in America. I think everyone will, and should, care if we become an authoritarian regime like that of Russia.
